description: From Middle English newly, newely, neweliche, from Old English nīewlīċe (“newly”), equivalent to new +‎ -ly. Compare Dutch nieuwelijks, German neulich, Danish nylig, Icelandic nýlega. More at new, -ly.

adverbs.description: newly (comparative newlier or more newly, superlative newliest or most newly)

entries.meaning: Very recently/lately; in the immediate past.
examples: She smelled the newly budding flowers.
